keywords.indexterm: Content Reuseinsert a direct content reference

taskbody.context: You can use the same content in multiple topics by inserting a DITA content reference to that content. The following steps describe the procedure of inserting a DITA content reference:

step.cmd: Position your cursor inside the element that you want to reference and in the Attributes view enter a value in the ID field.
step.info: If you want to reuse just a part of the content of an element, select the content with your cursor, press Enter and in the proposals list select ph. This encapsulates your content inside a phrase(<ph>) element, allowing you to set an ID and then reference it.

step.cmd: Open the topic where you want to insert the reference to this element.
Select Insert Content Reference on the main toolbar (or from the DITA menu).
step.stepresult: The Insert Content Reference dialog box is displayed.

step.cmd: In the URL field of the Insert Content Reference dialog box, select the topic that holds the element you want to reference.
step.stepresult: In the Target ID section of the Insert Content Reference dialog box, presents the elements that you can reference.

step.cmd: Click the ID of the element you want to reference, then click OK.
step.info: If you select an interval of elements, the Conrefend field is filled with the id value of the element that ends the selected interval.
step.stepresult: A reference to the selected element is inserted at the cursor position.
